title: S&P 500 ends near flat after Fed's mixed signals on future policy
text:
S&P 500 ends near flat after Fed's mixed signals on future policy

Stock Markets 3 hours ago (Sep 18, 2019 04:06PM ET)

© Reuters. Traders work on the floor at the NYSE in New York (Reuters) - The benchmark S&P 500 index ended almost flat on Wednesday as Federal Reserve policymakers gave mixed signals about their next move after cutting interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point in a widely expected move. The Dow Jones Industrial Average ( ) rose 36.35 points, or 0.13%, to 27,147.15, the S&P 500 ( ) gained 1.02 points, or 0.03%, to 3,006.72 and the Nasdaq Composite ( ) dropped 8.62 points, or 0.11%, to 8,177.39.

S&P 500 ends near flat after Fed's mixed signals on future policy
description: S&P 500 ends near flat after Fed's mixed signals on future policy
